properties.Pipeline: North Brooklyn Pipeline or Metropolitan Reliability Infrastructure Project
properties.Project Name: Metropolitan Reliability Pipeline Project or North Brooklyn Pipeline Project
properties.What's the plan?: Expand a stretch of pipeline at a liquified natural gas storage facility in Greenpoint, Brooklyn. And build two new vaporizers, a machine that transforms liquified natural gas into the gaseous formused for cooking and heating.
properties.What Now?: National Grid halted pipeline expansion and had their request for the vaporizers, which was submitted in the fall of 2022, was denied in March of 2023 after activists in the community led a campaign to stop it.

properties.What's the plan?: Push more gas to NYC by expanding the Athens compressor station, a facility along the pipeline route that boosts the flow of gas. This is one of four compressor stations the company seeks to expand.
properties.What Now?: The Iroquois Pipeline Company was awarded a state air permit from New York's Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC) on February 7, 2025 and given the green light to move forward with the project.

properties.Location: 186 Dover Furnace Rd, Dover Plains, NY 12522
properties.What's the plan?: Push more gas to NYC by expanding the Dover compressor station, a facility along the pipeline route that boost the flow of gas. This is one of four compressor stations the company seeks to expand.
properties.What Now?: The Iroquois Pipeline Company was awarded a state air permit from New York's Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC) on February 7, 2025 and given the green light to move forward with the project.

properties.What's the plan?: Push more gas to NYC by expanding the Brookfield compressor station, a facility along the pipeline route that boost the flow of gas, to more than double its size. This is one of four compressor stations the company seeks to expand.
properties.What Now?: The Iroquois Pipeline Company was awarded a state air permit from New York's Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC) on February 7, 2025 and given the green light to move forward with the project.

properties.What's the plan?: Push more gas to NYC by expanding the Milford compressor station, a facility along the pipeline route that boost the flow of gas. This is one of four compressor stations the company seeks to expand.
properties.What Now?: The Iroquois Pipeline Company was awarded a state air permit from New York's Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC) on February 7, 2025 and given the green light to move forward with the project.

properties.What's the plan?: To expand the Algonquin Gas Transmission Pipeline by 25 percent through a proposal, still in the early stages of development, known as "Project Maple."
properties.What Now?: Enbridge has begun to solicit bids from utility companies for icreased gas supply. They are yet to apply for any permits to move forward with the plans.

properties.Location: 960 Burnt Meadow Road, Township of West Milford, Passaic County, N.J
properties.What's the plan?: Push more gas through to Westchester in New York by building a new compressor station, a facility along the pipeline route that boosts the flow of gas.
properties.What Now?: In October of 2023, the New Jersey's Department of Environmental Conservation gave the Tenesse Pipeline Company the green light to move forward with the project despite a Superior Court ruling that it violated a law that protects the State's natural resources. The project's facility has been placed in service.

properties.Location: 164 Libertyville Rd County Rte, Wantage Township, NJ 07461
properties.What's the plan?: Push more gas through to Westchester in New York by trippling the size of an existing compressor station, which is a facility along the pipeline route that boosts the flow of gas.
properties.What Now?: In October of 2023, the New Jersey's Department of Environmental Conservation gave the Tenesse Pipeline Company the green light to move forward with the project despite a Superior Court ruling that it violated a law that protects the State's natural resources. The project's facility has been placed in service.

properties.What's the plan?: Push more gas through to Westchester in New York by upgrading the company's Pennsylvania based compressor station, which is a facility along the pipeline route that boosts the flow of gas.
properties.What Now?: The project's facility has been placed in service, according to a December 2024 report issued by the Tennessee Gas Pipeline company to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC).

properties.Project Name: Southern Tier CO2 to Clean Energy Solutions
properties.Location: Broome, Tioga, and Chemung counties in NY
properties.What's the plan?: Introduce a new fracking technique in New York that uses carbon dioxide (CO2) instead of water to extract gas from underground
properties.What Now?: Governor Kathy Hochul signed legislation that makes CO2 fracking ilegal. Sothern Tear Solutions has not moved forward with their plans so far.

properties.What's the plan?: To transform a peaker plant that only functioned during peak demand into a fullservice power plant.
properties.What Now?: In 2021, the DEC denied an air permit the company needed to move forward with the plans, citing that the project was unable to "satisfy" elements of the State's Climate Act. Danskammer tried to overturn the decision with a series of lawsuits but in June the company withdrew their attempts to continute to defy the decision.

properties.Company: NRG - Astoria Gas Turbine Power, LLC
properties.What's the plan?: Replace a 50-year-old high-polluting “peaker plant” with a more modern fracked gas facility.
properties.What Now?: In 2021, DEC denied an air permit needed for the project and the company has not sought to overturn that. In its denial, the environmental agency said the project was unable to "satisfy" elements of the State's Climate Act.

properties.What's the plan?: Transform an existing fracked gas peaker plant into a more modern and efficient power generating station in Sunset Park.
properties.What Now?: Shortly after the State issued denials for the expansion of similar projects in Astoria and Gowanus, the company withdrew their proposal on December 15, 2021.

properties.What's the plan?: Build the Williams Pipeline, a gas infrastructure project that would start in Pennsylvania, make its way through New Jersey and end in New York City’s Rockaways. It would have connected to the Rockaway Lateral, a pipeline that runs under Jacob Riis Park and Jamaica Bay
properties.What Now?: After three attemts to get permits to build their pipeline, the company finally gave up and notified state authorities in May of 2024 that it would let a 2019 federal permit that green-lit the project expire and would not be seeking an extension.

properties.What's the plan?: A petiton was filed in April of 2024 to bring more gas to the town of Town of Chemung by constructing a pipeline that will accommodate the gas generated from a  renewable natural gas landfill (“RNG”) to be built by WB Chemung.
properties.What Now?: A public hearing to discuss the project was held in December of 2024.
